<i>&quot;there are more general agendas and principles that you hopefully follow whenever you get together with other people to play a game.&quot;</i>


Attachment:

<a href='https://spoutinglore.blogspot.com/2018/08/the-agenda-behind-agenda.html'>The Agenda Behind the Agenda</a>


Games that identify themselves as Powered by the Apocalypse (PbtA) pretty much always have a list of agenda items and principles for the GM. Like, here's Dungeon World</i>'s discussion of GM agenda:  Your agenda makes up the ...
<div id='comment z12ihz2hfz22wjwqq04cjroqpqz5wpqwn4o'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/107904205842562911668_photo.jpg'> Emir Pasanovic (pasanov)</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-08-05 19:14:55 (edited: 2018-08-05 19:14:55)</cite></p>
        <p>Didn&#39;t you mean &quot;address the characters, not the players&quot; or am I remembering this wrong this whole time?</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12ihz2hfz22wjwqq04cjroqpqz5wpqwn4o'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/102595580176380683252_photo.jpg'> Jeremy Strandberg</h4>

        <p><span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/107904205842562911668" oid="107904205842562911668">Emir Pasanovic</a></span> I think that’s what I said, isn’t it? (It’s possible I fixed it in an edit but didn’t remember doing so... I made a number of quick fixes right after posting.)</p>

<div id='comment z12ihz2hfz22wjwqq04cjroqpqz5wpqwn4o'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/107904205842562911668_photo.jpg'> Emir Pasanovic (pasanov)</h4>

<div id='comment z12ihz2hfz22wjwqq04cjroqpqz5wpqwn4o'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/107904205842562911668_photo.jpg'> Emir Pasanovic (pasanov)</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-08-05 19:45:51 (edited: 2018-08-05 19:45:51)</cite></p>
        <p>The reason why I brought it up is an interaction w/ a 5e DM on Rolecast: he outwright told me I need to start writing &quot;So-and-so Does this or that&quot; instead of &quot;I do this or that&quot; when acting as my character. Apparently it&#39;s easier to follow when you say the name AND have it next to your avatar at every given time because it increases the roleplay in everyone...?<br /><br />Anyway, I don&#39;t appreciate ppl telling me how to roleplay when it makes no sense and I was literally doing it right without insulting or otherwise hurting anyone present or otherwise. So I said I won&#39;t do it and he kicked me out.<br /><br />Now, how&#39;s that for a GM principle? It&#39;s pretty much insane to me to go to any group and tell them how to roleplay. I will always address my players as their characters but insisting they address eachother the same way or say/write his actions a certain way that is not part of the game... Insane.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12ihz2hfz22wjwqq04cjroqpqz5wpqwn4o'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/102595580176380683252_photo.jpg'> Jeremy Strandberg</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-08-05 22:58:08 (edited: 2018-08-05 22:58:08)</cite></p>
        <p>Hey <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/107904205842562911668" oid="107904205842562911668">Emir Pasanovic</a></span>.  So, your story is an interesting test/application of the &quot;social-level&quot; principles I posted.<br /><br />Let&#39;s consider the GM&#39;s basic request: <i>Hey Emir, I&#39;d like you to write your posts in 3rd person, saying, like &quot;Thrognor draws his sword&quot; instead of &quot;I draw my sword.&quot;</i> <br /><br /><i>I know that&#39;s different from how you might usually play, but I find it makes the whole thing read a lot better and it&#39;s easier for everyone to track what&#39;s going on. The other players are all on board and have gotten used to posting like this, and we find it works better for us. Is that cool with you?</i><br /><br />Stated like that, it&#39;s the GM <b>communicating wants</b> and <b>talking about what they like</b> in order to <b>play the game they want to play</b>.  I also think the request as I wrote it is <b>treating you with respect</b>.<br /><br /><br />Now, from you how you describe it, the GM did <i>not</i> treat you with respect, and it&#39;s not clear that he gave you any context beyond &quot;I think it&#39;s better that way.&quot;  <br /><br />But if it <i>had</i> been phrased as a request, respectfully, and with context, would you have taken issue with it?</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12ihz2hfz22wjwqq04cjroqpqz5wpqwn4o'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/107904205842562911668_photo.jpg'> Emir Pasanovic (pasanov)</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-08-06 07:46:52 (edited: 2018-08-06 07:46:52)</cite></p>
        <p>Sure, opening with a demand around the table is never a good thing. First time he said it I didn&#39;t even understand what he was talking about the way he put it.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12ihz2hfz22wjwqq04cjroqpqz5wpqwn4o'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/118403207422664686120_photo.jpg'> Charles Moore</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-08-06 14:39:08 (edited: 2018-08-06 14:39:08)</cite></p>
        <p><span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/107904205842562911668" oid="107904205842562911668">Emir Pasanovic</a></span>  One of the things I find frustrating when listening to Actual Play podcasts/tubes is when players use first person with their characters.  It takes me out of the moment since I have to process who they are based on the sound of their voice.  It can take a while to unfold, during which time I&#39;m not listening to what they are saying.  <br /><br />I&#39;ve been listening to the KOTN AP podcast since 2012, and still have trouble matching voices to characters. <br /><br />The GM in your game may experience a similar dilemna.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12ihz2hfz22wjwqq04cjroqpqz5wpqwn4o'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/107904205842562911668_photo.jpg'> Emir Pasanovic (pasanov)</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-08-06 15:20:12 (edited: 2018-08-06 15:20:12)</cite></p>
        <p>It&#39;s play by text, my character&#39;s dialogue has an avatar and his name at all times. (except when I&#39;m typing in OOC chat, when it&#39;s just my nickname).</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12ihz2hfz22wjwqq04cjroqpqz5wpqwn4o'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/103522231327065742687_photo.jpg'> Matthew G.</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-08-07 03:18:31 (edited: 2018-08-07 03:18:31)</cite></p>
        <p>This reminds a lot of discussion around the Social Contract, which was a pretty hot topic in the early-ish 2000s. <a href="https://gnomestew.com/treasuretables/improving-your-gming/social-contracts-for-rpg-groups/" data-embed="_--ig7ecASwKKmh0dHBzOi8vZ25vbWVzdGV3LmNvbS9hdXRob3IvY2FtZG9ud3JpZ2h0L0JgCN4CCM8CCAASJ2h0dHBzOi8vZ25vbWVzdGV3LmNvbS9hdXRob3IvY2xpZ2h0MTAxL6KDt5wBKQonaHR0cHM6Ly9nbm9tZXN0ZXcuY29tL2F1dGhvci9jbGlnaHQxMDEvQlgI3gIIzwIIABIjaHR0cHM6Ly9nbm9tZXN0ZXcuY29tL2F1dGhvci9kYXJjeS--ig7ecAScKJWh0dHBzOi8vZ25vbWVzdGV3LmNvbS9hdXRob3Ivc3BlbnNlci9CXAjeAgjPAggAEiVodHRwczovL2dub21lc3Rldy5jb20vYXV0aG9yL2RuYXBoaWwvooO3nAEnCiVodHRwczovL2dub21lc3Rldy5jb20vYXV0aG9yL2RuYXBoaWwvQl4I3gIIzwIIABImaHR0cHM6Ly9nbm9tZXN0ZXcuY29tL2F1dGhvci9mbGF0dnVybS-ig7ecASgKJmh0dHBzOi8vZ25vbWVzdGV3LmNvbS9hdXRob3IvZmxhdHZ1cm0vQlgI3gIIzwIIABIjaHR0cHM6Ly9nbm9tZXN0ZXcuY29tL2F1dGhvci9zZW5kYS-" data-attachment-render-hint="2" class="ot-anchor">https://gnomestew.com/treasuretables/improving-your-gming/social-contracts-for-rpg-groups/</a></p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12ihz2hfz22wjwqq04cjroqpqz5wpqwn4o'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/110647526896176491992_photo.jpg'> Greg Soper</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-08-08 15:39:46 (edited: 2018-08-08 15:39:46)</cite></p>
        <p><span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/102595580176380683252" oid="102595580176380683252">Jeremy Strandberg</a></span> I&#39;m lucky that I&#39;ve never been at a table that egregiously violated these principles. But it is very worth talking about. Not being mindful of helping everyone have a good time makes it that much more easy to violate these principles in lots of smaller ways. GM-ing is complicated, and it can become easier to prioritize the fictional world and ignore the real world.</p>
</div>
